intro: Plumeria cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf plumeria, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that come in shades of white, yellow, and pink. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Plumeria cuneifolia is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of scented oils.
